alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 21 at 7:27PM EDT until July 22 at 9:58AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... South Fork Peachtree Creek at Johnson Rd Atlanta affecting Fulton and DeKalb Counties. For the Peachtree Creek...including Johnson Rd Atlanta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Peachtree Creek at Johnson Rd Atlanta. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14 feet, Minor flooding continues along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Johnson Road. Portions of backyards of residential homes on Noble Drive...Helen Drive and Kay Lane will be flooded with around one foot of water. This height combined with the flow on North Fork Peachtree Creek will likely produce flooding further downstream on Peachtree Creek in Fulton County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 12.1 feet and rising rapidly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage around 8 PM and rise to a crest of 14.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
